note.p: Career: Secretary to the Observatory, Paris; commissioned with Biot to complete meridional measurements; had to escape from Majorca, but was captured by Spanish corsair on his way to Marseilles, which he finally reached (1809); made geodetic observations with Biot on coasts of France, Scotland and England (1818); measured the second's pendulum at Leith and at Unst, Shetland; played a prominent part in the revolution (1830); refused to take the oath of allegiance to Louis Napoleon (1851); died of Bright's disease and dropsy
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1850-1854 vol 6 pp 359-365
References: K K Schwarz, 'Faraday and Babbage' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp367-381
